export const aeCustomPanelPost = {
  slug: 'ae-custom-panel',
  title: "Building a Custom Panel for After Effects with AI",
  date: "March 29, 2024",
  author: "Martin Tomek",
  tags: ["After Effects", "Automation", "VFX", "Workflow", "Discord"],
  series: [{
    type: 'article',
    title: "Part 1: From Frustration to Automation",
    content: `
        As a Compositing TD, I found myself repeatedly doing the same tasks in After Effects:
        tracking week numbers, exporting files with specific naming conventions, and sending 
        Discord notifications. I thought, "There has to be a better way!"

        What started as a simple idea evolved into a custom panel that:
        â€¢ Automatically tracks production week numbers
        â€¢ Handles file exports with standardized naming
        â€¢ Sends automated Discord notifications
        â€¢ Saves hours of repetitive work weekly
        
        This panel has transformed my daily workflow, turning 30-minute tasks into 
        one-click operations.
      `
  }, {
    type: 'article',
    title: "Part 2: The AI-Powered Development Process",
    content: `
        The breakthrough came when I discovered how to combine Claude AI with Cursor IDE. 
        As someone focused on compositing rather than coding, this combination was perfect:

        â€¢ Claude helped understand After Effects' scripting API
        â€¢ Cursor IDE provided real-time AI coding assistance
        â€¢ Together they made complex development accessible
        â€¢ Each feature built confidence for the next

        The key insight? Modern AI tools make development accessible to artists. You don't 
        need years of coding experience to create powerful workflow tools.
      `
  }, {
    type: 'article',
    title: "Part 3: Making it Production-Ready",
    content: `
        The final piece was integrating the panel with our production pipeline using EEAct 
        (a React framework for After Effects):

        â€¢ Clean, modern interface that feels native to After Effects
        â€¢ Reliable week number tracking for consistent deliverables
        â€¢ Automated file exports with error prevention
        â€¢ Seamless Discord integration for team communication

        The most satisfying part? Seeing other artists save time and reduce errors using 
        something I built to solve my own frustrations.
      `
  }],
  conclusion: {
    summary: `
      This project showed me that automation isn't just about saving time â€“ it's about 
      creating more reliable processes and reducing human error. With AI assistance and 
      modern frameworks, creating custom tools is more accessible than ever.
    `,
    callToAction: {
      text: "Want to try it yourself?",
      links: [{
        text: "View Source on GitHub",
        url: "https://github.com/Themolx/AeCustomPanel"
      }]
    },
    inspiration: `
      Remember: Every repetitive task is an opportunity for automation. What workflows 
      could you improve with a custom tool? The barrier to entry is lower than you 
      might think! ðŸš€
    `
  }
};

sourcesContent:
export const aeCustomPanelPost = {
  slug: 'ae-custom-panel',
  title: "Building a Custom Panel for After Effects with AI",
  date: "March 29, 2024",
  author: "Martin Tomek",
  tags: ["After Effects", "Automation", "VFX", "Workflow", "Discord"],
  series: [
    {
      type: 'article',
      title: "Part 1: From Frustration to Automation",
      content: `
        As a Compositing TD, I found myself repeatedly doing the same tasks in After Effects:
        tracking week numbers, exporting files with specific naming conventions, and sending 
        Discord notifications. I thought, "There has to be a better way!"

        What started as a simple idea evolved into a custom panel that:
        â€¢ Automatically tracks production week numbers
        â€¢ Handles file exports with standardized naming
        â€¢ Sends automated Discord notifications
        â€¢ Saves hours of repetitive work weekly
        
        This panel has transformed my daily workflow, turning 30-minute tasks into 
        one-click operations.
      `
    },
    {
      type: 'article',
      title: "Part 2: The AI-Powered Development Process",
      content: `
        The breakthrough came when I discovered how to combine Claude AI with Cursor IDE. 
        As someone focused on compositing rather than coding, this combination was perfect:

        â€¢ Claude helped understand After Effects' scripting API
        â€¢ Cursor IDE provided real-time AI coding assistance
        â€¢ Together they made complex development accessible
        â€¢ Each feature built confidence for the next

        The key insight? Modern AI tools make development accessible to artists. You don't 
        need years of coding experience to create powerful workflow tools.
      `
    },
    {
      type: 'article',
      title: "Part 3: Making it Production-Ready",
      content: `
        The final piece was integrating the panel with our production pipeline using EEAct 
        (a React framework for After Effects):

        â€¢ Clean, modern interface that feels native to After Effects
        â€¢ Reliable week number tracking for consistent deliverables
        â€¢ Automated file exports with error prevention
        â€¢ Seamless Discord integration for team communication

        The most satisfying part? Seeing other artists save time and reduce errors using 
        something I built to solve my own frustrations.
      `
    }
  ],
  conclusion: {
    summary: `
      This project showed me that automation isn't just about saving time â€“ it's about 
      creating more reliable processes and reducing human error. With AI assistance and 
      modern frameworks, creating custom tools is more accessible than ever.
    `,
    callToAction: {
      text: "Want to try it yourself?",
      links: [
        {
          text: "View Source on GitHub",
          url: "https://github.com/Themolx/AeCustomPanel"
        }
      ]
    },
    inspiration: `
      Remember: Every repetitive task is an opportunity for automation. What workflows 
      could you improve with a custom tool? The barrier to entry is lower than you 
      might think! ðŸš€
    `
  }
};
